We have nearly 100 users in product environment, connecting elasticsearch. So make sure you are using right version, and don't open auth(such as xpack, basic auth)

Here is the [test report](http://github.com/SkywalkingTest/agent-integration-test-report/tree/master/2019/4/bfergerson/testReport-master-2019-04-13-23-01.md) and [validate logs](http://35.227.88.23:49001/job/skywalking-agent-automated-testing/430/artifact/skywalking-agent-testcases/workspace/logs/validate-2019-04-13-23-01.log)
3.3+ works, do you want 3.1 and 3.2 supported?

@wu-sheng, I should be able to get it to support 3.2+. This is when Vert.x introduced the `ClusteredMessage` which is what I use to tell if a message on the event bus is going to be written to the wire. Without that object, it looks like determining whether or not a message is going on the wire is rather involved. I don't think I will be able to support 3.0.0 and 3.1.0. Should I still rename the plugin to reflect the versions it supports? If so what would you like me to call it?

3.x in name should be fine. Can you confirm two thing?
1. This plugin wouldn't make 3.0 and 3.1 codes break 
2. Supported list document include 3.2+
I think this is a rarely-appeared bug and since the RocketBot UI is going to replace the current UI, I'll close this for now
Appreciate you do this. I wrote too many documents, need recheck.

@wu-sheng, I think from adding the witness class there should not be any problems with Vert.x 3.0.0 and 3.1.0. I've also updated the documentation to state that for the eventbus only 3.2+ is supported.

I've also split the integration tests so now it tests the web and eventbus separately. The integration tests for the web module are working for all versions in 3.x and eventbus is 3.2+, of course.

What is your question?
Hello, Do I need to cluster SkyWalking to monitor more than 100 microservices with SkyWalking?  I have clustered es, and reduced the esqueque_size, flush related information configuration.
That depends on your serivce payload and how many CPUs and memory it could use. In normal case, you need, otherwise, why you set elasticsearch in cluster mode.
ok, thank you~
Your elasticsearch can't connect, I don't know why.
Okay thank you~
@BFergerson We finally made this through 28 days.

We can close this now with https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking/pull/2386 being accepted. This gives Skywalking basic support for Vert.x. As I continue to monitor my Vert.x applications with Skywalking I'll expand on this support. Thanks for all the help @wu-sheng. Looking forward to the release of 6.1 ;).
Welcome to submit pull request to query more, 5000? Maybe, and provide setting for max value.
@BFergerson Thanks. Welcome to contribute other plugins. The 6.1 release should happen next month.
Any update? We need your integration test PR.

Sorry for missing the reply messages. To achieve this feature we need to use `ConstructHijackInter` to replace `ConstructInter` as they can not be coexistence with each other. 

But to do this we need to change all Plugins' interface methods from `onConstruct` to `beforeConstruct` and `afterConstruct`. I think this extensive changes **should be appraised**. And I will test the `ConstructHijackInter`'s stability first.
I think we don't need replace, because most people don't need to change argument of construct. Instead, we could provide a new interception way, what do you think?
@wu-sheng I have finished loading pod info from k8s via java-k8s-api. After you review my codes, I will build an image to figure the integration test out.

Basically, this is totally fine. As a widely used project, we have a support old interface, especially most users don't need the new feature at this moment.

I am going to opem this issue, again. In case you will submit pull request.

@yeerpeng Sorry to keep this open for a long time. @peng-yongsheng is working on a global solution, as we found the metric delete may trigger a crash too, when resource is limited. He will try to submit a pull request in 6.1 or 6.2

I have to close this. Sorry.
I am not sure. Maybe because of host file, or something unknown bug. I think you need to dig a little more.
@Stephen-sen Don't worry about it, this is a distributed consistency problem. we use the document version to avoid different OAP server get the same document id. So, you get this conflict log.
ok,I see,thank you

Client: collector instantiated a LoadBalancer: DynamicServerListLoadBalancer:{NFLoadBalancer:name=collector,current list of Servers=[],Load balancer stats=Zone stats: {},Server stats: []}ServerList:null

Is this normal?
@wu-sheng Don't mention it. I am looking forward to your perfect solution and wish skywalking more and more development ：）
请问skywalking怎么配置邮件告警
This is very old issue. Please read new document, there is webhook for alarm. You could implement a server to forward alarm to mail.

> but jvm has reorder characteristics， that order maybe change to 1，3，2

I am not very familiar with this `reorder`, but even this is happening, this should trigger NPE.  Because the file writer should only be accessed by one thread only. Do I miss anything?

Or are you facing NPE?

yes, actually its only one thread.
im just find a double check in FileWriter when i am doing a new log implement(fluentd) 
My subconscious is that INSTANCE in double check should be volatile.  haha

If there is no real NPE happens, and only single thread scenario, let's keep the codes unchanged, OK?

I don't want to misguide people that, this object could/is being accessed across thread. For the double check, is only the performance concern.
ok
